page.title: 10CHANGES IN ECCLES
page.content: The small community,which has its origins in the cement industry,is on the east bank of the Medway.The population is approx 1200.Luncheon Club interviews revealed that Eccles once had 14 shops & now has only 2.Old folk recalled children playing whip & top in the streets & many horse drawn vehicles & ploughs.The School building was formerly a church consisting of one large room which has since been divided into classrooms & a kitchen since the coming of school meals.The orginal houses built for cement workers are 19th century and consist of of tightly packed terraced houses on one side of the village.houses built in Mackenders & Greenfield Close date mainly from the 1950's & were erected by both council & private contractors.New bungalows & flats in Eccles row are occupied by old folk.
